meanings.definition: Surroyal (noun): the topmost part of a ship's mast
meanings.sent1: The surroyal swayed gently in the breeze atop the mast.
meanings.sent2: Sailors climbed up to the surroyal to get a better view of the sea.
meanings.sent3: The seagull perched on the surroyal, pretending to be the captain of the ship.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the surroyal cast a long shadow over the deck.
meanings.sent5: The surroyal gleamed in the sunlight, a beacon for sailors at sea.

meanings.definition: Surroyal (adjective): of or relating to the highest part of a ship's mast
meanings.sent1: The surroyal flag fluttered proudly at the top of the mast.
meanings.sent2: The surroyal platform offered a breathtaking view of the ocean.
meanings.sent3: The surroyal telescope helped the sailors spot land from afar.
meanings.sent4: Her voice echoed from the surroyal, commanding attention from the crew.
meanings.sent5: The surroyal lantern illuminated the night, guiding the ship through darkness.
